title: Understanding expressive limitations and challenges of graph neural networks (GNNs)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic graph theory and understanding of neural networks
context.additional_context: Aims to improve practical application skills in mathematical modeling and data structures for employed learners. Smartphone-based supplementary learning materials are available

learning_goals: Explain the message-passing technique, the fundamental operation principle of GNNs, and analyze its application to graph data processing
Identify key issues causing GNN's expressive limitations (e.g., over-smoothing) and evaluate their impact in real-world cases
Compare research trends to overcome GNN limitations (e.g., decomposition-based approaches, continual learning techniques) and apply them to project-based problem-solving

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
